title: Create a DataPoint
name: Create_a_DataPoint
description: Create a DataPoint to t6. This needs to post the datapoint over a flow from your own collection. The payload can be crypted using aes-256-cbc algorithm and optionally signed as well. Using both encrypting and signature require to sign the payload first and then to encrypt the new payload as an enveloppe. On both Sign & Encrypt, it is required to claim the object_id in the body so that the symmetric Secret Key can be found on the object as well as the Crypt Secret.

Parameter.description: Flow ID you want to add Data Point to. This parameter is optional as it can be defined in the payload itself

body.description: Flow ID you want to add Data Point to
Flag to publish to Mqtt Topic ; This parameter might become deprecated.
Flag to store in database the Value

body.defaultValue: Default value from the Flow resource
Default value from the Flow resource

body.description: Optional object_id uuid used for Signed payload; for decrypt and encrypting in the Mqtt; The object_id must be own by the user in JWT.
Optional String to identify where does the datapoint is coming from. (This is only used for rule specific operator)
Optional String to identify where does the datapoint is coming from. (This is only used for rule specific operator)
influx_db_cloud object to define what bucket should be used to save data on the cloud

title: Authenticate - JWT Token
name: Authenticate_-_JWT_Token
description: The authenticate endpoint provide an access token which is multiple use but expiring within 5 minutes. Once it has expired an access_token can be refreshed to extend duration or you can generate a new one from this authenticate endpoint. Several Authentification process are handled: using your personnal credentials, using a Key+Secret Access long life Token (which can be revoked)

body.description: Grant type is either "password" (default) to authenticate using your own credentials, or "refresh_token" to refresh a token before it expires.
The refresh_token you want to use in order to get a new token

Success 200.description: Token that can be used to refresh the Token

Error 4xx.description: Bad Request, require a Bearer Authentication or revision is incorrect.
Forbidden - Token used in transaction is not valid. Check your token and/or permission.
